Class DoubleSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

              • thobe.widgets.inputSlider.DoubleSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class DoubleSlider
extends Slider<java.lang.Double>
    Represents a widget that can be used to slide through double values.
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void _setRange(java.lang.Double minimum, java.lang.Double maximum, java.lang.Double tickSpacing) 
      java.lang.Double getDecreasedValue()
      Returns the next value (>= min-range), computed by subtracting the tickSpacing from the current value.
      java.lang.Double getIncreasedValue()
      Returns the next value (<= max-range), computed by adding the tickSpacing to the current value.
      void setDefaultRange()
      Within this method the initial range of the slider have to be set, using setRange(..).
      void setRange(java.lang.Double minimum, java.lang.Double maximum)
      Set the range of the slider.

      • setRange

        public void setRange(java.lang.Double minimum,
            java.lang.Double maximum)
        Description copied from class: Slider
        Set the range of the slider. The tickspacing used will be calculated with the following equation: tickspacing = (maximum-minimum)/10
        Specified by:
        setRange in class Slider<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        minimum - - lower bound of the sliders range
        maximum - - upper bound of the sliders range
